Comment: Impeachment is not the same as a criminal trial. The standards for removal from office do not require a crime having been committed. This is why an impeached official can *still be prosecuted for crimes* relating to the issue they were impeached over, which was the course of events that American framers of the impeachment process envisioned.  (It's also why the Constitution does not prohibit charging elected officials with crimes and putting them on trial for those crimes *while in office* \- the avoidance of putting sitting officials on trial is a matter of US Justice Department policy, not established law.)

Comment: The key phrase there is "high crimes and misdemeanors". Maladministration would absolutely be covered under high crimes and misdemeanors.
